free: #e Unexpectedly, (they) want me to tell a story.
#c 他們竟然要我講故事。
#e Rarely, I will tell a story today.
#c 我今天難得來講故事。
#e A boy and a dog raised a frog. Meihua, I'm somewhat easily moved (to tell a story).
#c 一個男孩和一隻狗養了一隻青蛙。梅花，我稍微比較好講話。
#n 梅花是說話者的妻子。
#e A boy raised a dog.
#c 一個小孩養了一隻狗。
#e The boy and the dog raised a frog together.
#c 那男孩和狗一起養了一隻青蛙。
#e One night, it was very late when (people) had slept.
#c 一天晚上，已經很晚了，（人們）都睡了。
#e Why (did he) put (the frog) in a container?
#c (他)怎麼會把（青蛙）放進去瓶子裡。
#e The bottle neck is so small.
#c 瓶口就只有這麼小而已。
#e How do (people) say that in Mandarin?
#c (那個)用國語怎麼說?
#n kokugo "國語"。
#e How do (people) describe the bottle in Tsou?
#c 用鄒語怎麼講那個瓶子是...
#e The bottle is the bottle which can be seen through.
#c 那個瓶子是可以看穿的瓶子。
#e One evening, (the boy) went to sleep. The dog went to bed with him-- the dog which he raises.
#c 一天晚上，夜已經很深了，男孩睡了，狗也跟著睡了。就是小孩子所養的狗。
#n 句中雖然用i-he(3PL.GEN), 由上下文可推指的還是故事中的'男孩'
#e Why did the frog come out?
#c 那青蛙怎麼會跑出來?
#e The frog had escaped from the mouth of the container.
#c 青蛙已經從瓶口跑掉了。
#e The child rose.
#c 這小孩起來了。
#e And they just somewhat ... He knew that dog, (no, it's) the frog escaped.
#c 然後他們就稍微... 他已經知道狗....(不，是)青蛙跑掉了。
#e The dog felt very sad, because it saw the frog escaped.
#c 小狗覺得很難過因為青蛙逃走了。
#e The dog also liked the frog very much.
#c 狗也很喜歡那隻青蛙。
#e It felt very sad, and went to look for the frog together with the boy.
#c 小狗很難過，就跟小孩一起找青蛙。
#e The dog kept on thinking where the frog had gone.
#c 狗一直在想青蛙跑到哪裡去了。
#e The dog thought that (the) from stayed in the bottle.
#c 狗心想青蛙本來在瓶子裡。
#e The dog made its head enter into the container.
#c 狗把頭伸進去瓶子裡。
#e The dog thought that I have to make sure and find whether it was really gone.
#c 狗想說我想要確定的找一下它是不是真的從瓶子裡跑掉。
#e The dog inserted it head into (the container) where the frog (used to) stay.
#c 狗把頭伸入(原來)青蛙在的(瓶子)裡，沒想到頭卡住了。
#e The dog can't take pull its head at the neck of the bottle from the mouth of the bottle.
#c 狗沒有辦法把在瓶頸的頭從瓶口拉出來。
#e It just always carried the bottle where the frog lived.
#c 牠就隨身帶著青蛙住的那個瓶子。
#e  Because (the container) was transparent, the dog still could see the path it walked.
#c 因為（瓶子）是可以看穿的，所以牠還不會看不到東西，還是可以看到他所走的路。
#e  The dog got its head stuck in the container.
#c 瓶子一直卡在狗的頭。
#e The dog looked for the lost frog together with the boy.
#c 小狗和小孩一起找青蛙。
#e They went to look for their pet frog in the mountains. They were very distressed (when they thought of their frog.)
#c (他們想到青蛙)心裡很難過,就在山裡走一走一起尋找他們以前養的青蛙。
#e (They) went to (a place) full of trees.
#c (他們)走到一個都是樹(的地方)。
#e They unexpectedly saw (something) hanging on the tree. What is that?
#c 他們竟然看到有一個東西吊在樹上。是什麼東西?
#n <WH WH> : whisper sound
#n <WH WH> : whisper sound
#e The bees chased the dog.
#c 蜂追著狗。
#e At that time, the child also saw.... He saw a hole.
#c 此時，小孩也看到..他看到一個洞。
#n 此處應為i-si [AUX.NAF-3SG.GEN]
#e He thought that the frog was inside the hole. Unexpectedly, it is a mouse that appeared from the hole.
#c 他以為青蛙在裡面，原來跑出來的是老鼠。
#n 此處應為i-si [AUX.NAF-3SG.GEN]
#e The dog has shaken down the bee hive. The mouse also moved out and escaped.
#c 狗把蜂窩搖下來，老鼠也衝出來，也跑掉。
#e The boy climbed the tree to hide (from something). He hided, and saw a tree hole.
#c 小孩子也爬到樹上想要躲。他躲藏起來，也看到一個樹洞。
#e He also looked for the frog; see if it was in the tree hole.
#c 他也尋找看看青蛙有沒有在洞裡面。

gloss: 被追得跑過來跑過去.受焦
free: #e At that time, the dog also escaped, because the bees kept chasing it.
#c 那時候狗也跑掉，原來他一直被蜜蜂追著跑。
#e The child was afraid.
#c 小孩子很害怕。
#e The hands holding the tree branch got loosen and the child fell.
#c 小孩抓住樹枝的手鬆掉，掉了下來。
#e Unexpectedly, from the tree, where the child was climbing, the tree hole appeared an owl.
#c 竟然從小孩子本來爬的樹洞哪裡出來了一隻貓頭鷹, (叫做)puku的鳥。
#e The owl flew everywhere.
#c 那時候貓頭鷹飛來飛去。
#e The boy kept looking for the frog. He climbed up a tree and wanted to grab a tree branch.
#c 小孩還是一直找青蛙，他爬上一棵樹，想要抓住樹枝。
#e the tree log at...
#c 在...樹的樹頭...。
#e many trees, which is small on,...
#c 小的...的一些樹。
#e the remnants of trees
#c 剩下的樹頭。
#e He didn't see clearly about what he thought as tree branches.
#c 他沒仔細看他以為是樹枝的東西。
#e Unexpectedly, it was the antler of a deer.
#c 原來是鹿的角。
#e Unexpectedly, it was the antler of a deer. Therefore... Then he knew it's a deer.
#c 原來是鹿的角，因此就... 他因此就知道那是鹿。
#e The deer rose and somehow it just coincidently shouldered the child.
#c 鹿起身，怎麼就那麼剛好小孩就被鹿揹著。
#e The boy was just hanging on to the deer's antlers.
#c 小孩就只能這樣在掛在鹿的角上。

gloss: 看.處焦助動詞.非主焦-3SG.屬格
free: #e The dog even cried for this, (because) it saw the child was carried by the deer.
#c 狗甚至為這件事哭泣（因為）狗看到小孩在被鹿帶著跑。
#e The dog liked this child very much.
#c 狗非常喜歡這個小孩子。
#e The deer just carried (the child) and run to somewhere.
#c 鹿就帶著小孩就這樣跑。
#e Unexpectedly, the deer just took them running toward the cliff.
#c 原來鹿要帶小孩到懸崖。
#e And then, the child fell. The dog also fell. It is because it ran too fast.
#c 然後小孩子掉下來，那隻狗也跟著掉下來，因為(牠)跑得很快。
#e Unexpectedly, they fell into deep water.
#c 原來他們掉到很深的水池。
#e The dog and the child fell into very deep water.
#c 他們掉下去的地方水很深。
#e Luckily they were not injured. Both of them fell into the water.
#c 幸好他們都沒有受傷，他們兩個都掉進水裡。
#e They just stay there.
#c 他們就在水那邊。
#e They saw there was a small tree log floating on the water. And they thought,
#c 他們看見有小樹漂浮在水面上，（他們）心裡想說。
#n s'a mo s'a 是不是
#n s'a mo s'a 是不是
#e whether the frog they are looking for was inside the tree. The boy told his dog not to be noisy.
#c 是不是他們在找的青蛙就在樹裡面。男孩告訴狗不要吵。
#e (They) just looked for (the frog) very carefully.
#c (他們)就仔細的找青蛙。
#e Surprisingly they saw two big frogs.
#c 怎麼會找到兩隻很大的青蛙。
#e (He) was very surprised and said,
#c 他就非常驚訝的說。
#e The frog which we kept looking for was here.
#c 原來我們一直在尋找的青蛙在這裡。
#e The boy was very glad.
#c 那男孩很高興。
#e He saw.. Why there were so many frog?
#c 他看... 怎麼青蛙那麼多。
#e Why there were two big frogs, and unexpectedly... (there were) so many small frogs.
#c 怎麼會有兩隻大的青蛙，還有竟然...有那麼多小的青蛙。
#e Since he was so glad as to walk across the water and,
#c 因為他太高興，就走過水。
#e (He would) go to the place with many small frogs. (These frogs) were sitting in line.
#c 就要走到有很多小青蛙的地方，（那些小青蛙）整排的站著。
#e Maybe the two big frogs were the parents of the small frogs.
#c 或許這兩隻大的青蛙是小的青蛙的爸爸和媽媽。
#e The child was too happy.
#c 小孩太過興奮。
#e Why would the frog say,
#c 奇怪，青蛙怎麼會說?
#e The frog spoke to the child.
#c 青蛙對著小孩子說。
#e Unexpectedly, you were looking for the,... We saw that it has escaped.
#c 原來你一直在找..., 牠已經跑掉了. 我們有看到牠已經跑掉了。
#n 此處應為 toekameosʉ [run.AF]
#e It had left our place.
#c 牠離開我們這裡。
#e  It was distressed, since you just put it in the bottle. Therefore it left.
#c 牠很難過，因為你們竟然只有把牠放在瓶子裡，因此牠才跑掉了。
#e (They) didn't raise it carefully; they just put it in the container.
#c (他們)沒有好好的飼養，只把他放在瓶子裡。
#e I usually swan in the water. Why was I put in a bottle?
#c 我平常是在水中游泳的，怎麼把我放在瓶子裡面。
#e The boy was very angry, since the frog said such words to him.
#c 小孩子很生氣，因為青蛙這樣對他講。
#e He took a small frog in the water and tossed it to the frog.
#c 他拿起在水面上的一個小青蛙，朝著那隻青蛙丟過去。
#e The child was very distressed, because their favorite frog had left.
#c 小孩子心裡太難過，因為小孩子和狗最喜歡的青蛙已經離開了。
#e This is my saying. I'm not sure whether it is correct.
#c 我說到這裡，不知道說得對不對。
